params.markdown:
Search engines need to return quickly since users are waiting on their results. There is a direct correlation between search time and user experience.

As a general rule, Search stored procedures should take less than a second to run on average. 

Search stored procedure performance is impacted by elements such as:

* Data size. Larger data consumes more CPU, Ram, Disk I/O on the database server. 
* Policies such as acls, filtering, etc. 
* Indexes. Sometimes they fragment degrading overall performance. 
* Table/Index Locking with other database actions.

Strategies for improving database search performance include:

* Rebuild fragmented database indexes.
* Evaluate if more RAM/CPU

When these don't work, Developers will need database execution plans to review options.
